align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2297675"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2297675#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2294167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2294167" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="juxtapositionjones"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066682"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1066682.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="juxtapositionjones" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2294167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2294167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1066682">juxtapositionjones</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-24">09/24/24 20:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this to add to my bottle collection. <br />
The scent inside is somewhat of a disappointment. <br />
No, it's not really a delicious gourmand indulgence. Although the initial first 20 minutes where similar to a cup of warm milk and brown sugar. Then during dry down, it changed.<br />
It went into a fresh, dry, heated bomb. It's a smell I have smelt many times before from modern unisex fragrances with a so called "dark chocolate" essence. It's not dark chocolate. It's dry and fresh. <br />
It's not for me<br />
But I imagine loads of youngsters will like it.<br />
And I love the bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2294167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2294167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2293789" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2293789" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="xxhanamonster"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2257204"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="xxhanamonster" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2293789ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2293789" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2257204">xxhanamonster</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-24">09/24/24 11:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like how this perfume smells. I have yet to try the original Sweet Tooth or Cherry Baby so I can't comment on how they compare. This one definitely leaves a lot to be desired in terms of longevity. I paired it with Viktor&amp;Rolf's Bon Bon because they have similar scent profiles, and I knew the Bon Bon would last much longer. I do prefer the overall scent of Caramel Dream and if they made a more intense version that lasted more than an hour, this might even be something I'd use as a signature scent. The other two Sweet Tooth perfumes should be coming within the next few weeks, and I hope they will smell as good but last a whole lot longer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2293789"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2293789#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2292237" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2292237" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="witch_x3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254041.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="witch_x3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jessica-Simpson/Fancy-4094.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4094.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fancy"title="Fancy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2292237ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2292237" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254041">witch_x3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-23">09/23/24 04:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There's something so... dusty about the drydown of this. Maybe it is the sandalwood? This is also much less longlasting than the original Sweet Tooth which is a true marshmallow scent. If people are looking for a sweet caramel scent I'd recommend Let the Good Times Roll - Lush. Or, Cheirosa 71.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2292237"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2292237#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2291124" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2291124" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vktr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1317649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vktr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2291124ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2291124" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317649">vktr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-22">09/22/24 01:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To be honest, I never tried the original version, so I won't compare them.<br />
The packaging sets it apart from my other perfumes on the shelf and I just love a fully developed product - even the bottle tells you what to expect. <br />
<br />
My first impressions are that I smell the freesia quite strongly and distinctively. Strangely enough, when it wears off a bit I feel the chocolate on one hand and the orchid on the other. The longevity for me was around 5 hours with moderate to light sillage. Although the pyramid is mostly sweet, the scent itself is quite rich and not another "sweet" perfume. <br />
<br />
It's definitely not as sweet as I was expecting, perhaps a more mature version of Prada Candy so if you want a rich caramel, give it a try. I'm trying to cut on perfumes but based on my impressions on this one, I will try the original Sweet Tooth when I can.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2291124"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2291124#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2291073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2291073" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pafaitshen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2239267"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2239267.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pafaitshen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2291073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2291073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2239267">pafaitshen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-21">09/21/24 23:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i like this one better than the original version tbh, it feels more sophisticated in a sense? you get less of the sweeter notes of the original and more warmth and depth i feel in this one. it lasts fairly okay on the skin for its price as well, the projection is pretty alright as well! im already out of it but i dont think i would repurchase another bottle. the packaging is soo cute though!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19560">LadyMuck</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-15">09/15/24 18:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I find this to be a more masculine leaning version of the OG Sweet Tooth.<br />
It is very deep with the dark chocolate and aromatic.<br />
It does settle down into a sweeter fragrance after being on the skin for an hour but save your money <br />
and just go for the original fragrance if you like girly, sweet fragrances.<br />
6/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2284078"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2284078#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2281347" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; (but the body spray isn't on here so im using this)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2280993"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2280993#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2278685" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2278685" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jasminejjj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2243511"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2243511.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jasminejjj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2278685ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2278685" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2243511">Jasminejjj</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-10">09/10/24 21:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow wow wow, Listen. I 100% HATE patchouli. But now I 99% hate patchouli because of this fragrance. Lol I dont have a clue who Sabrina Carpenter is or whos behind the innovation of these fragrances but theyre doing the Lords work lmao. Caramel Dream opens up similar to the OG but takes a swift turn into Dark Chocolate Sea Salt heaven. I dont get orange or lemon notes. It must be blended in beautifully. The dry down is very powdery, woody, patchouli, &amp; a slight your skin but better sweetness. I honestly dont even get that much caramel from this. If you like the OG but thought it was a little too juvenile then try this one. This is definitely the grown up version of the pink bottle. But beware, This is nowhere near as gourmand as the pink bottle. This is truly a less sugary dark chocolate bar. I pair this with Nemat Amber oil &amp; the smell is unique &amp; intoxicating. So earthly &amp; grounded is the best way I can describe the pair. I smell like earth &amp; cocoa powder lol :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2278685"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2278685#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2278245" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Cozy I think would be a could word to describe this scent. This perfume also reminds me of Taylor Swifts Incredible Things fragrance but I wouldnt say its a dupe by any means. The longevity isnt the best but I can get a couple hours out of it (if I layer with the body mist its longer). Definitely a good fall fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2278245"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2278245#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2276468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2276468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2276468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2274294" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2274294" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LindaL100"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1482401"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1482401.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LindaL100" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2274294ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2274294" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1482401">LindaL100</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-07">09/07/24 00:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>although I like Sabrina Carpenter's original Sweet Tooth fragrance, but I like this Caramel Dream slightly better, it's abit more sweeter due to the caramel note and I find the scent to be a bit stronger compared to the original Sweet Tooth. However like the original, the longevity of the Caramel Dream is quite weak on my skin too, both fragrances only lasted a few hours on my skin. So far I have only tried Sabrina's first 2 fragrances from her Sweet Tooth range, and while they both smell nice and I like the cute packagings, but I have been disappointed by their weak longevity on my skin. They remind me alot of Anna Sui's fragrances, many of Anna Sui's fragrances smell very nice too with very cute and beautiful packagings, but their longevity on my skin are poor and weak, they usually only last a few hours on my skin tops, just like Sabrina's fragrances. I have not tried Sabrina's newest fragrance Cherry Baby yet, but I hope the longevity of it will be better than her first 2 Sweet Tooth fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2274294"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2274294#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2274009" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2274009" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hsiangchi.huang"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hsiangchi.huang" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2274009ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2274009" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282935">hsiangchi.huang</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-06">09/06/24 15:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've been on a hunt for gourmands and blind bought this along with the original sweet tooth. <br />
<br />
When I first tried both of them on the skin, the performance was terrible. The sillage/projection was non-existent and I had to bury my nose into the skin to smell it. Then I tried it (caramel dream) on my hair, it lasted! I can smell it for 6-8hrs but not sure if others can smell it too. I saw some reviews saying the longevity of caramel dream is slightly better than the original, but imo both are the same. <br />
<br />
In terms of the scent, caramel dream is simply salted caramel with a hint of nuttiness. Thankfully, I don't get any patchouli and I can't stomach patchouli. As delicious as it may sound, it definitely smells cheap and juvenile. But I do like this one more than the original, as the original is just way too one dimensional and lack that saltiness to balance out the sweetness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2274009"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2274009#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2268943" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2268943" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pastrypuff34"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2216913"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pastrypuff34" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2268943ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2268943" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2216913">pastrypuff34</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-02">09/02/24 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i got this because i really like the original sweet tooth, so it wasnt exactly a disappointment that caramel dream smells exactly like the original! im giving my caramel dream to my friend that wants it, but its still an objectively good perfume! its like sweet tooth but a little sharper, with a bit more citrus and earthiness</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2268943"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2268943#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2268494" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2268494" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="allisonswimsak"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2224894"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="allisonswimsak" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2268494ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2268494" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2224894">allisonswimsak</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-01">09/01/24 17:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i want to love this, but the patchouli and sandalwood overpower all of the sweetness for me. as a gourmand girl, this misses the mark</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2268494"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2268494#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2266371" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2266371" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lbustos2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055934"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2055934.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lbustos2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Princess-90174.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90174.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Princess"title="Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2266371ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2266371" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055934">Lbustos2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-30">08/30/24 18:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>They should have named this Sweet Tooth Patchouli. To me, this smells like when you go backpacking for a few days, and you really want to shower, but cant so you resort to using baby wipes and spraying yourself with a marshmallow scented body mist from Bath and Body Works that you randomly found buried underneath the seat of your car. Personally, this smells like stinky armpits. However, I am not a patchouli girl. Its just not something that smells GOOD on my skin. <br />
<br />
Toffee caramel candies your grandmother loves. Patchouli. Jett puff. Somebody blew out birthday candles in the next room. <br />
<br />
This perfume smells like someone is yelling the word patchouli in my ear, while someones eating Jet puff about 4 feet away. <br />
<br />
Its not my thing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2266371"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2266371#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2262952" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2262952" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="afw1219"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220304"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="afw1219" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-s-Secret/Bombshell-Passion-62570.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62570.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bombshell Passion"title="Bombshell Passion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2262952ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2262952" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220304">afw1219</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-27">08/27/24 15:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried both this and OG sweet tooth and will be getting both, but I ultimately went for this one first. As many other reviews say, this is OG's slightly more mature version. it's a little bit freaky, but if you're not super into masculine notes for date night, this is a good place to start depending on how you wear it (will get into more below). It also has substantially better longevity and projection, probably due to the more controversial notes. <br />
<br />
I will say I agree that this smells much more like a chocolate perfume than a caramel perfume. It very much reminds me of the chocolate in clinique's cocoa and cashmere, but this is much less linear. if cocoa and cashmere is for layering, this is a version that's complete (and a little more evening/date night vibes). if you like the sweet in this but hate the woody notes, go try that one. compared to notable caramel bombs like viva la juicy gold couture, prada candy, and V&amp;R bon bon this is not that gourmand caramel scent. it is still very sweet and edible, just in a different way. it also has some of that cloud/BR540 DNA, so if you hate those, you won't like this. <br />
<br />
For me the performance is decidedly good enough. It's not a Lancome perfume, so my sinuses survive, but it doesn't go unnoticed, and I get lots of compliments when I am within an arm's length of someone. I usually spray 3-4 times and I find that projection lasts 3-4 hours before it dwindles to less than a foot. then it's more of a skin scent that lasts on my clothing until whenever I wash it again. <br />
<br />
i totally understand why there are mixed reviews on whether this is a sweet dreamy fragrance or if it's too masculine. on my skin the patchouli jumps out--my skin chemistry is really weird and can turn even versace bright crystal into an obnoxious peppery musk bomb--so on skin this smells like kind of a spicy woody with less sweet. Like peppery chocolate. Honestly it wasn't bad and I got a ton of compliments even up until five hours later, and skin wear boosts the projection, but I did get a little exhausted of smelling the more masculine notes more than I was smelling gourmands. No one else reported this when I asked; they said it smelled more sweet and a little woody, so it was just my wearer's experience. I have way better luck with this on clothes, where I personally get to enjoy it more and I get just as many compliments. If you totally hate patchouli though, you should run, because this is not like LVEB where you won't notice it. <br />
<br />
it makes for an OK fragrance day or night just depending on how much you like gourmands, but it's probably not for church/the office/meeting SO's parents for the first time. for me the dream combo for date night will be to spray this on skin to get the depth and spice, but then layer with OG sweet tooth to boost the sweet notes. excited to try the cherry version at another time.<br />
<br />
<br />
edit: coming back a month later to update that i am even more obsessed with this perfume. it totally grew on me. i wanted to update my layering combo -- it's better with pink sugar than OG sweet tooth, something about the ginger in the OG doesn't go well. pink sugar also boosts the longevity and projection substantially, and i find that this perfume grabs onto others really well. so rather than just smelling like the better-performing perfume, you will still smell like both.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2262952"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2262952#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2262738" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2262738" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vanilla_latte"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2217176"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2217176.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vanilla_latte" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Marshmallow-Pumpkin-Latte-56359.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56359.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Marshmallow Pumpkin Latte"title="Marshmallow Pumpkin Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2262738ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2262738" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2217176">vanilla_latte</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-27">08/27/24 11:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Alright, so I have to admit, I do like this perfume! I had super high hopes because of all the great reviews, but the second I sprayed it on my wrist, it was like a blast of alcohol. It took a few minutes for it to calm down and settle down to its scent. What I picked up was mostly powder, amber, and patchouli. It reminds me of Bath &amp; Body Works' marshmallow pumpkin latte, but not as sweet and way more woody. After about 10 minutes on my skin, it does get a little sweeter, but Im still feeling a bit disappointed! But atleast, the packaging and bottle are adorable!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2262738"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2262738#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2260863" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2260863" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vpace91"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1948953"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1948953.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vpace91" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/By-the-Fireplace-31623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="By the Fireplace"title="By the Fireplace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2260863ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2260863" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1948953">vpace91</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-25">08/25/24 15:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have the body mist and it basically just smells like patchouli and sweetness. I don't really get any caramel at all. I'll have to try the actual perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2260863"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2260863#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2258657" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2258657" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dromoney"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460425"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="dromoney" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2258657ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2258657" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460425">dromoney</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-23">08/23/24 13:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i just got this one in the mail today and it starts off a little on the earthy side where the patchouli undoubtedly makes a head start from the base notes along with the citrus on top. as it dries however, its relation with the original sweet tooth becomes evident as the vanilla/fluffy sweetness from the original is here but it pulls less chocolatey unlike the original and you get a bit more earthy patchouli which might in turn make the unmistakable vanilla note appear more caramel, i say this bc there isnt any phase of this where there is an undeniable caramel note at least on first wear. nevertheless it is a sweet fragrance. i know there is this aversion to patchouli amongst fragrance ppl but it is a viable note to include in perfumes, and this is no exception. this is a LOT more long wearing and provides more projection than the original and patchouli is a note that helps encourage those qualities. not a bad fragrance at all and i say get it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2258657"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2258657#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2251752" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2251752" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ellycube"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1861075"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1861075.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ellycube" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-76824.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76824.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sweet Tooth"title="Sweet Tooth"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2251752ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2251752" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1861075">Ellycube</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-16">08/16/24 18:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have the body spray version and it's transformed a lot in the year of owning it! At first the citrus top note was too strong and it felt off. But that quickly went away and it smelled like a delicious sophisticated caramel chocolate that I'd love wearing around the house when it's cold. But now a year later the only thing I smell are the woody notes and it's overpowering and almost a little smokey. It doesn't smell like the delicious gourmand it used to be :( It also has never lasted very long at all, I recommend trying the perfume over the body spray!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2025491">Lady Patches</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-05">08/05/24 19:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like this one. I'm probably the only one who thinks it smells like a cheap but dark and spicy version of "Scandal Le parfum JPG"<br />
<br />
It smells a bit citric, some spiciness, and the main notes are dark chocolate and caramel, it which has patchouli, which makes it more mature than the first one (pink one). Is really good, just a bit floral, sweet, and sexy. As the first one, the longevity is weak/mild. Is not strong, so it can be used anytime.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2240102"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2240102#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2237097" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2237097" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mrgnliana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153169"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153169.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mrgnliana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kerosene/Unknown-Pleasures-17438.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17438.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unknown Pleasures"title="Unknown Pleasures"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2237097ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2237097" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153169">mrgnliana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-02">08/02/24 16:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one surprised me. Im not a huge fan of patchouli but it can vary in intensity from fragrance to fragrance. I definitely smell it on initial spray, but after it drys down it blends really nicely with the other notes. I sprayed it on paper and skin. On paper it smells a lot like bbw into the night, but on skin the caramel and vanilla really shine. I cant wear this in hot weather, but I bet this does amazing in cold weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2237097"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2237097#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2235473" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2235473" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gecko_emoji"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942747"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1942747.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gecko_emoji" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84095.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sweet Tooth Caramel Dream"title="Sweet Tooth Caramel Dream"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2235473ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2235473" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1942747">gecko_emoji</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-01">08/01/24 04:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I hoped this would be a little more gourmand based on the notes, dont get me wrong it definitely smells chocolatey and creamy but with an underlying earthiness from the patchouli that keeps it from being truly edible smelling. Maybe I am overly disappointed because I am a big fan of perfumes that smell like you can eat them! But its not expensive, the bottle is really cute and unique and its a fun perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2235473"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2235473#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2231076" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2231076" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Skinscents4Fusspots"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/119688"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.119688.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Skinscents4Fusspots" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vera-Wang/Embrace-Periwinkle-Iris-31091.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31091.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Embrace Periwinkle & Iris"title="Embrace Periwinkle & Iris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2231076ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2231076" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/119688">Skinscents4Fusspots</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-27">07/27/24 11:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one really moves through the note pyramid in a noticeable way, starting thin and a bit fruity then moving into sweet caramel territory before the patchouli in the base takes over the composition. <br />
<br />
I got a sample of this because the original Sweet Tooth replaced Philosophy Fresh Cream Warm Cashmere in my collection, which isnt available in the UK and has a bitter tone in the dry down that spoilt it for me. I wondered if this one would be a good alternative to Fresh Cream Soft Suede (which I love and appears to have been discontinued!) but I dont think Sweet Tooth Caramel smells like any of the fresh cream perfumes. Its very much a caramel (maybe like a millionaires shortbread) and patchouli perfume to my nose.<br />
<br />
Im so glad I didnt blind buy this one because the patchouli is way too strong for my liking!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2231076"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2231076#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2230190" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1184254">bv1026</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-15">07/15/24 19:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not sure if it was a bad batch that i got, but it is super faint, could barely smell it. It doesn't even last an hour on my skin. On my clothes it lasts longer, but I could barely get a whiff of it. Similar DNA to the og sweet tooth, but this one smells a bit spicier. I get a lot of spice and woody tones to it. Not sweet to me at all, which is a bummer considering i love gourmands.<br />
<br />
EDIT: The longer I've had it the more the scent is alright to me. I don't hate it, I sorta like it, but not enough to repurchase or even wear often if I'm being honest. It smells too masculine for me and I get NO hint of caramel or anything sweet, unfortunately.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2219678"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2219678#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2219333" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I much prefer this to the original Sweet Tooth - as lovely as that one Is, theres something that doesnt quite work with my body chemistry.. to me they do smell similar but Caramel Dream definitely suits me better </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
