align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1904314"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1904314#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903839" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1903839" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LEM922"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275562"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275562.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LEM922" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1903839ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1903839" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275562">LEM922</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-16">08/16/23 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sniffed this today in Walmart, and ended up picking up the original sweet tooth for my collection. This does smell really good. However, it definitely smells unisex to me. A little more feminine, leaning, but unisex nonetheless. I think people who arent prepared for that might be a little taken aback by it, as its not really expected. It does smell sweet! And it smells really nice. But it does have a masculine undertone to it. Smells very much like chocolate covered caramel, so definitely true to the name. I think the lemon, sandalwood, and patchouli are kind of mingling together, which is making it smell a little more cologne like. So definitely sniff first, I found mine at Walmart. Same price as the original.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1903839"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1903839#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1902226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1902226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sleepystars"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1802045"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1802045.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sleepystars" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Thank-U-Next-2-0-68367.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68367.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Thank U Next 2.0"title="Thank U Next 2.0"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1902226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1902226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1802045">sleepystars</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 15:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first want to mention that this fragrance, as of today (August 14th 2023), is unreleased. There is no advertising for it anywhere on the Scent Beauty website or from Sabrina herself. I found out about this fragrance when I was looking for perfume on the Walmart website and saw the caramel-colored sweet tooth bottle on the banner for the fragrance section. It wasn't announced, or even for sale on the website. I looked it up and found it on Fragrantica, and searched tiktok and found some reviews. A lot of people said that even though it wasn't on the Walmart website, they had found it in their local Walmart in store. I searched two local Walmarts with no luck finding the EDP version of this fragrance, however at the first store I went to they had ONE body mist left, which I ended up purchasing for $10. They also had the label for the EDP of Caramel Dream next to the original, but it was sold out. The second Walmart location I went to didn't even have a label for the body mist or the perfume. I'm still satisfied with my purchase of the body mist and will DEFINITELY be layering it with the EDP come fall/winter. If anybody reading this owns the original Sweet Tooth, this new one has the "DNA" of the original, but is the slightly less sweet, woodier, warmer, spicier version of the pink bottle. I like Sabrina's first fragrance, and have used almost a third of the liquid from my 30ml bottle. It's a good cold weather scent. Caramel Dream on the other hand, I LOVE. Caramel Dream is less heavy on my nose. Maybe because it's the body mist being compared to the Sweet Tooth EDP (lol), but even disregarding the strength of the smell, the new one is more pleasant to me. It's more complex than the original, and slightly less youthful. The opening almost smells like Froot Loops to me. My mother disagreed, but my opinion still stands. It's a slightly creamy, gentle orange, with a light hint of lemon. The citrus is not bright or sharp rather, sweet and gentle. On the dry down, it's gently warm spicy, musky, woody, and a little chocolatey. The caramel is hiding in the background, as well as vanilla shyly peeking through, throughout the entire time. The dry down holds onto a little bit of the citrus if you give it a good whiff. I can't really speak on longevity or sillage, because it's the body mist and not the EDP so it's not great in the performance section, but if the Caramel Dream EDP's performance is anything like the original Sweet Tooth, it will be decently moderate to long lasting. I will update my review when I am able to purchase the perfume version, but overall, LOVELY fragrance. This will definitely be one of my everyday wears during the colder months and I will be layering the mist and perfume. 12/10 &lt;3</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1902226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1902226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1901921" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; patchouli with musky amber floating in the background reminds me of the sweet accords of the VANILLE in tobacco vanille I love it. This fragrance has a dry sweetness with woody earthy tones honestly this version is perfectly unisex at best.. Woody Gourmand is the best way to say it.. its balanced. Mildly sweet, woody &amp; mature.. good job Sabrina got the 30ml at Walmart for testing and Id say definitely buying a big bottle of this</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1901243" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Princessy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416040"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1416040.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Princessy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1901243ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1901243" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1416040">Princessy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-13">08/13/23 10:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Strong opening with the freesia and lemon that are very present in the first 5 minutes. After that, the original DNA comes in with an added deepness and the dark chocolate. I do not get sweet caramel per say, but I get the sandalwood, amber and musk<br />
<br />
Even if it lasts longer and contrary to the popular opinions, I prefer the OG Sweet Tooth. Caramel Dream is less sweet and too spicy for my liking and the original is the perfect mix of marshmallow, sugar and a touch of ginger.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1901243"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1901243#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1900695" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1900695" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amyaz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219813"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1219813.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amyaz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1900695ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1900695" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1219813">amyaz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-12">08/12/23 16:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reminded me alot of mixbar's vanilla bourbon. Smells good for the price. Definitely has similarities with the original but this is definitely warmer vs the original always felt more fresh/cool and good for summer, this version is definitely fall.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1900695"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1900695#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1899849" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dani D-va"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/742409"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.742409.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dani D-va" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Luminous-87256.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87256.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Luminous"title="Luminous"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1899849ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1899849" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/742409">Dani D-va</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-11">08/11/23 16:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This starts off very similar to the original but with an added chocolate almond milk note. Then maybe 15 minutes in the chocolate and vanilla become even stronger and more decadent. Once its fully dried down the woody note comes through and honestly its a bit much for me and takes away from the gourmand aspect a little bit. I smell more sandalwood than caramel in the dry down and I dont love that. To be fair the original took a couple months to macerate and it wasnt an immediate love for me either but after I let it sit for about 2 months it became incredibly creamy and delicious smelling. It also became longer lasting. Im hoping the same will happen with this one and in that case I will update my review. <br />
As of now I enjoy it but I prefer the original to Caramel Dream.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1899849"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1899849#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899715" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1899715" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="peachdais"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1812888"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1812888.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="peachdais" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1899715ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1899715" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1812888">peachdais</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-11">08/11/23 12:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this scent is superior to the original in my opinion! i dont know why no one else has said it but the initial opening to me smells just like a smore! warm toasty vanilla marshmallow with chocolate and warm, sweet woods. the wood notes in this really come out on me during the dry down, it adds this wonderful creaminess to the scent. this fragrance has a lot of depth for a $30 celebrity fragrance in my opinion. this will be great for fall but honestly i see myself reaching for it every season. i hope sabrina and scent beauty see the success of this launch and decide to keep it around!! im lucky i got my hands on the last bottle at my location!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1899715"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1899715#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899527" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1899527" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SamSweet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/662945"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.662945.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SamSweet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kerosene/Unknown-Pleasures-17438.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17438.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Unknown Pleasures"title="Unknown Pleasures"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1899527ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1899527" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/662945">SamSweet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-11">08/11/23 07:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>love this!  It has hints of the original, but its way more mellow and warm, but still super sweet. on first spray its bright and sweet, the almond milk gives it a creamy almond smell, almost like an icing thats not /too/ sweet. it still has the caramel, amber, and patchouli backing it up giving it some body and making it feel more balanced than the original ST (imo) I sprayed it on about 4 hours ago and can still smell it (and be smelled by others) it seems fairly inoffensive, but thats not a bad thing. it feels like an older sister to the original Sweet Tooth. it smells like a dark chocolate cupcake with lots of icing and caramel drizzled on top. but not cloyingly sweet, especially when compared to original ST. 8/10 imo i wish the performance was better. It reminds me some of Incredible Things by Taylor Swift! If you told me this has a Cashmere note in it, i'd believe you!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1899527"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1899527#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1898389" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; in the dry down i get the sandalwood, almond milk, musk with slight caramel and citrus. <br />
<br />
i definitely prefer this over the original.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1898127"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1898127#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1897938" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1897938" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vicky456"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387792"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1387792.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vicky456" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1897938ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1897938" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1387792">Vicky456</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 11:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Has the original dna (which is a powdery chocolate marshmallow scent on me), but dense with it being more chocolate heavy. I get some subtle orange from it, kinda reminiscent of those chocolate orange balls from Terrys with a light caramel in the back. The caramel comes out a bit more 2 hours later on me and its a lightly sweet caramel, kinda like if you stretched out a chewy caramel candy &amp; got whiffs of it. Its slightly sugary as well, but not heavy at all. The chocolate dna from the og still runs throughout it at this point. Roughly on hour 5 it smells only like chocolate caramel on me &amp; the caramel is a lot more prevalent now. And at hour 5 there is something in the background that is also in Silk Santal &amp; Mod Vanilla, i cant really pinpoint exactly what but there is something subtly bright &amp; sweet in the background in this that lasts an hour on me, that is also in the background of those 2 other scents lol.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1897938"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1897938#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1897674" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1897674" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="applejack78"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1281241"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1281241.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="applejack78" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1897674ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1897674" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1281241">applejack78</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 04:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The marketing, or should I say non-marketing, around this perfume is shady af solely to build up hype. Sabrina hasn't promoted it on social media. No release date was announced. It's not available on any retail website, other than existing on Walmart for a hot minute. The distributing company (I'm assuming) dropped a few bottles in random Walmart stores for some people to find like Willy Wonka and his golden tickets. Those lucky few who find and buy the perfume at Walmart are now doing the marketing for Sabrina by leaving reviews on Tiktok, Reddit, etc. Most of the people seeing the reviews can't buy the perfume, are confused how the reviewer got it, and questioning why they didn't even know about it beforehand.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; </div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1943100" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1943100" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="baekhyun"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1487403"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1487403.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="baekhyun" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Virgin-Island-Water-899.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.899.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Virgin Island Water"title="Virgin Island Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1943100ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1943100" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1487403">baekhyun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-03">10/03/23 06:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i was so worried about this because i love the original but i am nottttttttttttttttt a fan of patchouli or orange but!!!!! i barely smell the orange and the patchouli is the most wearable patchouli i've ever smelled. it's definitely THERE but rather than being omnipresent and overpowering the other notes, it hides in the background and adds some body to the caramel marshmallow sweetness. the almond milk also blends perfectly with the chocolate which is often (for me at least) a love or hate note in something. <br />
<br />
honestly it's exactly what a flanker should be, preserving the DNA of the original while carving its own identity on top of it. my only complaint has nothing to do with the perfume itself and just that my local walmarts all have their perfume section locked down like fort knox and no employees seem to know how to unlock it. i have to pathetically go ask around and annoy each worker for who has the keys like a sad little pauper locked out of his shanty. girl it's $29.99 let people steal it ive had ENOUGH!!!!!!!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1943100"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1943100#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2115811" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2115811" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="binkyluvr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577663"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1577663.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="binkyluvr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2115811ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2115811" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577663">binkyluvr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-05">04/05/24 21:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this is an example of patchouli done right. thank u miss sabrina. intense dark chocolate with lots and lots of caramel. def feels more on the sophisticated side!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2115811"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2115811#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1903839" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1903839" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LEM922"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275562"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1275562.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LEM922" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1903839ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1903839" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1275562">LEM922</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-16">08/16/23 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sniffed this today in Walmart, and ended up picking up the original sweet tooth for my collection. This does smell really good. However, it definitely smells unisex to me. A little more feminine, leaning, but unisex nonetheless. I think people who arent prepared for that might be a little taken aback by it, as its not really expected. It does smell sweet! And it smells really nice. But it does have a masculine undertone to it. Smells very much like chocolate covered caramel, so definitely true to the name. I think the lemon, sandalwood, and patchouli are kind of mingling together, which is making it smell a little more cologne like. So definitely sniff first, I found mine at Walmart. Same price as the original.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1903839"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1903839#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2041015" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2041015" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yelrog"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1958407"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1958407.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yelrog" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aquolina/Pink-Sugar-975.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.975.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pink Sugar"title="Pink Sugar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2041015ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2041015" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1958407">yelrog</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-24">01/24/24 17:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So. Mfing. Tasty. <br />
I blind bought this today ($30 at Walmart, hell yeah!) and its SO GOOD. Literally smells like a caramel mocha. I dont get a single note of citrus or floral, its just pure sugar. I absolutely adore it though, and it pairs so nicely with my body lotion and the Posh Chocolate body wash from Lush. <br />
This goes BEYOND gourmand because there isnt anything besides sweetness in this scent (to me anyways) and it makes me smell edible. <br />
If you wanna smell edible, hit up your local Walmart!! You literally cant go wrong if you already know you like sweet smells.<br />
<br />
Edit: I have been reaching for this one over and over and over in the past few weeks. The longevity is crazy, especially on clothing. I have a jacket that I spritzed it on over a month ago now that STILL smells like it so heavily. It even lasts until the end of the day on my skin, which hardly ever happens because my skin just eats scents like nobody's business. The projection is medium, it gives you a nice little cloud but it won't choke out the person sitting next to you in a car. Honestly the best fragrance purchase I've made in a while, everything about this was pleasantly surprising.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2041015"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2041015#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1902226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1902226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sleepystars"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1802045"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1802045.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sleepystars" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Thank-U-Next-2-0-68367.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68367.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Thank U Next 2.0"title="Thank U Next 2.0"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1902226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1902226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1802045">sleepystars</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 15:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first want to mention that this fragrance, as of today (August 14th 2023), is unreleased. There is no advertising for it anywhere on the Scent Beauty website or from Sabrina herself. I found out about this fragrance when I was looking for perfume on the Walmart website and saw the caramel-colored sweet tooth bottle on the banner for the fragrance section. It wasn't announced, or even for sale on the website. I looked it up and found it on Fragrantica, and searched tiktok and found some reviews. A lot of people said that even though it wasn't on the Walmart website, they had found it in their local Walmart in store. I searched two local Walmarts with no luck finding the EDP version of this fragrance, however at the first store I went to they had ONE body mist left, which I ended up purchasing for $10. They also had the label for the EDP of Caramel Dream next to the original, but it was sold out. The second Walmart location I went to didn't even have a label for the body mist or the perfume. I'm still satisfied with my purchase of the body mist and will DEFINITELY be layering it with the EDP come fall/winter. If anybody reading this owns the original Sweet Tooth, this new one has the "DNA" of the original, but is the slightly less sweet, woodier, warmer, spicier version of the pink bottle. I like Sabrina's first fragrance, and have used almost a third of the liquid from my 30ml bottle. It's a good cold weather scent. Caramel Dream on the other hand, I LOVE. Caramel Dream is less heavy on my nose. Maybe because it's the body mist being compared to the Sweet Tooth EDP (lol), but even disregarding the strength of the smell, the new one is more pleasant to me. It's more complex than the original, and slightly less youthful. The opening almost smells like Froot Loops to me. My mother disagreed, but my opinion still stands. It's a slightly creamy, gentle orange, with a light hint of lemon. The citrus is not bright or sharp rather, sweet and gentle. On the dry down, it's gently warm spicy, musky, woody, and a little chocolatey. The caramel is hiding in the background, as well as vanilla shyly peeking through, throughout the entire time. The dry down holds onto a little bit of the citrus if you give it a good whiff. I can't really speak on longevity or sillage, because it's the body mist and not the EDP so it's not great in the performance section, but if the Caramel Dream EDP's performance is anything like the original Sweet Tooth, it will be decently moderate to long lasting. I will update my review when I am able to purchase the perfume version, but overall, LOVELY fragrance. This will definitely be one of my everyday wears during the colder months and I will be layering the mist and perfume. 12/10 &lt;3</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1902226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1902226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="84095" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent2065449" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2065449" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="xenoarthropod"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136536"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1136536.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="xenoarthropod" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juliette-Has-A-Gun/Moon-Dance-27997.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27997.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Moon Dance"title="Moon Dance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2065449ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2065449" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136536">xenoarthropod</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-17">02/17/24 15:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Aromachemical warning: "That Cloud smell"<br />
<br />
My daughter and I smelled the body spray in the store to be sure it was OK before getting the really cool looking bottle. We looked it up here and had our hopes up with these notes and many of the reviews. It would have only been $30. for that cool bottle at Walmart. I am so glad the lovely employee allowed us to smell the body spray first.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately, we couldn't smell the notes properly because it has the same lingering stuff in it that is in Ariana Grande Cloud, Sauvage, and also added into so many of the newer female frags and body sprays lately.<br />
 All we smell is that "Cloud smell" and not much of the sweet or chocolate notes. Daughter smelled no chocolate at all. <br />
<br />
Surely we can't be the only ones bothered by that scent in these perfumes. The reviewers saying that is smells masculine or like a men's cologne are probably smelling it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2065449"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2065449#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2097409" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097409" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bijousmere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2045288"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2045288.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bijousmere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Nebras-78560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nebras"title="Nebras"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097409ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097409" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2045288">Bijousmere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 10:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>All I get is musk... I don't know why?!  I really wanted to like this.  But I should have known, when I tested the original Sweet Tooth it was WAY too musky for me.  Reminds me of Vanilla Fields or Vanilla Musk.  I can't get the smell out of my nose now.  So Walmart only had the OG to test.  I blind bought caramel dream, sprayed it in the parking lot and it's basically more of the same.  Extremely musky and just a hint of caramel.  RETURNING :(   I think if you LIKE musk and gourmands, you will like this.  For me, I should just steer clear of anything that has musk in it, because as soon as I detect it, that's all I can smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2097409"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2097409#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2164433" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2164433" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Futonbean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1415783"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1415783.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Futonbean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oscar-de-la-Renta/New-York-96887.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96887.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="New York"title="New York"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2164433ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2164433" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1415783">Futonbean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-22">05/22/24 12:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Somehow worse than the Original Sweet Tooth (which I really disliked - you can find my review for that on my page). <br />
<br />
It is EVEN MORE SYNTHETIC smelling than the original. But not the fun polly pocket, chewy synthetic lipstick accordy plastic smell. It's like gasoline cosplaying as a perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2164433"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2164433#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2266371" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2266371" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lbustos2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055934"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2055934.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lbustos2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Princess-90174.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90174.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Princess"title="Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2266371ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2266371" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055934">Lbustos2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-30">08/30/24 18:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>They should have named this Sweet Tooth Patchouli. To me, this smells like when you go backpacking for a few days, and you really want to shower, but cant so you resort to using baby wipes and spraying yourself with a marshmallow scented body mist from Bath and Body Works that you randomly found buried underneath the seat of your car. Personally, this smells like stinky armpits. However, I am not a patchouli girl. Its just not something that smells GOOD on my skin. <br />
<br />
Toffee caramel candies your grandmother loves. Patchouli. Jett puff. Somebody blew out birthday candles in the next room. <br />
<br />
This perfume smells like someone is yelling the word patchouli in my ear, while someones eating Jet puff about 4 feet away. <br />
<br />
Its not my thing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="2266371"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=2266371#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1930390" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1930390" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fruity_iykwim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1761110"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1761110.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fruity_iykwim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fine-ry/Without-A-Trace-91430.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91430.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Without A Trace"title="Without A Trace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1930390ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1930390" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1761110">fruity_iykwim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-17">09/17/23 13:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was sooo disappointed, this is going right back to walmart :( I didn't see anyone on tik tok say the patchouli was strong, but to me it definitely is. it's honestly somewhat in the realm of angel to me - super gourmand with lots of patchouli. as someone who doesn't like patchouli, it just smells like someone dipped their sundae in dirt lmao.<br />
<br />
caramel and dark chocolate are the only other notes I smell. for me, it's a headache, but if these notes are up your alley you'll probably like it! I was just looking for a pure gourmand.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="84095"comment_id="1930390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Sabrina-Carpenter/Sweet-Tooth-Caramel-Dream-84095.html?ccid=1930390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="84095" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="84095":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="84095" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

            <div class="sticky"
                 data-sticky
                 style="margin-left: -0.65rem; margin-top: 2rem;"
                 data-top-anchor="anchormehere45646:bottom"
                 data-btm-anchor="popBrands:top"
            >
                <!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_vrec_1 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x600" id="fragranticacom_perfume_vrec_1" v-pre>
</div>
            </div>
                <div style="clear:both; height: 1rem;"></div>
    
</div>
    </div>
</div>                        <div id="popBrands" class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 4em;"><span>Most Popular Perfumes</span></div>
            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-y grid-margin-x text-center">
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Khamrah-75805.html" class="en2inter">Khamrah Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">22.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgH0e5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
